item.title: Trusted types
item.description: The latest addition to the XSS protection landscape is Trusted Types, “an API that allows applications to lock down powerful APIs to only accept non-spoofable, typed values in place of strings to prevent vulnerabilities caused by using these APIs with attacker-controlled inputs”. Despite having gained a lot of attention for years, Cross Site Scripting (XSS) remains one of the most common types of vulnerabilities on the web.
